body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.): Yes

**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** 
Orphaned pod found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
could not determine device for path
Could not construct volume information, volume is not mounted

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one):
BUG REPORT

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):

```
$ kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6", GitVersion:"v1.6.2", GitCommit:"477efc3cbe6a7effca06bd1452fa356e2201e1ee", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-04-19T20:33:11Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6+", GitVersion:"v1.6.3-beta.0.43+ab61393ee6b119", GitCommit:"ab61393ee6b119161b69fe1622f96a2f91d82c7a", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-05-05T20:41:57Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: vsphere
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): 

```
# cat /etc/os-release
NAME="VMware Photon"
VERSION="1.0"
ID=photon
VERSION_ID=1.0
PRETTY_NAME="VMware Photon/Linux"
ANSI_COLOR="1;34"
HOME_URL="https://vmware.github.io/photon/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://github.com/vmware/photon/issues"
```


- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
# uname -a
Linux node1 4.4.8-esx #1-photon SMP Tue Jun 7 08:04:49 UTC 2016 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

- **Install tools**:
- **Others**:


**What happened**:
continuously getting error - 
`May 08 01:08:52 node1 docker[436]: E0508 01:08:52.696061     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.`

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.6/pkg/kubelet/kubelet_volumes.go#L114

 

Steps:
=====
1. POD with 3 Volumes was running on the node1.
2. Powered off node1's ESX host. POD is scheduled to restart on node2. 
3. vSphere HA is enabled, so node1 is moved to another available host. 
4. Out of 3 disks attached to node1, 2 disk successfully got detached from node1 and attached to node2 where the pod is scheduled, but 1 disk remained attached to node1.
5. This is causing pod to remain in `ContainerCreating` state forever.


**POD with 3 Volumes was running on the node1.**

```
$ kubectl describe pod
Name:		wordpress-mysql-380239133-nql1k
Namespace:	default
Node:		node1/fd01:0:101:2604:250:56ff:feb7:751d
Start Time:	Sun, 07 May 2017 17:12:43 -0700
Labels:		app=wordpress
		pod-template-hash=380239133
		tier=mysql
Annotations:	kubernetes.io/created-by={"kind":"SerializedReference","apiVersion":"v1","reference":{"kind":"ReplicaSet","namespace":"default","name":"wordpress-mysql-380239133","uid":"f977aec2-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056...
Status:		Running
IP:		172.1.43.3
Controllers:	ReplicaSet/wordpress-mysql-380239133
Containers:
  mysql:
    Container ID:	docker://457edf92ac3c3961cbd6e6330b1d7d245e6feaad9a1b2d6c30482c3a43af631c
    Image:		mysql:5.6
    Image ID:		docker://sha256:0977f3a915e5415a8b61d8087d5614926f667be6beaeb01f101271d670d00453
    Port:		3306/TCP
    State:		Running
      Started:		Sun, 07 May 2017 17:13:04 -0700
    Ready:		True
    Restart Count:	0
    Environment:
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD:	mysqlpassword
    Mounts:
      /var/lib/mysql from mysql-persistent-storage1 (rw)
      /var/lib/mysql2 from mysql-persistent-storage2 (rw)
      /var/lib/mysql3 from mysql-persistent-storage3 (rw)
      /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from default-token-m6tlc (ro)
Conditions:
  Type		Status
  Initialized 	True 
  Ready 	True 
  PodScheduled 	True 
Volumes:
  mysql-persistent-storage1:
    Type:	PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:	mysql-pv-claim1
    ReadOnly:	false
  mysql-persistent-storage2:
    Type:	PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:	mysql-pv-claim2
    ReadOnly:	false
  mysql-persistent-storage3:
    Type:	PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:	mysql-pv-claim3
    ReadOnly:	false
  default-token-m6tlc:
    Type:	Secret (a volume populated by a Secret)
    SecretName:	default-token-m6tlc
    Optional:	false
QoS Class:	BestEffort
Node-Selectors:	<none>
Tolerations:	<none>
Events:
  FirstSeen	LastSeen	Count	From			SubObjectPath		Type		Reason		Message
  ---------	--------	-----	----			-------------		--------	------		-------
  1m		1m		1	default-scheduler				Normal		Scheduled	Successfully assigned wordpress-mysql-380239133-nql1k to node1
  1m		1m		1	kubelet, node1		spec.containers{mysql}	Normal		Pulled		Container image "mysql:5.6" already present on machine
  1m		1m		1	kubelet, node1		spec.containers{mysql}	Normal		Created		Created container with id 457edf92ac3c3961cbd6e6330b1d7d245e6feaad9a1b2d6c30482c3a43af631c
  1m		1m		1	kubelet, node1		spec.containers{mysql}	Normal		Started		Started container with id 
```

**Powered off Node1's ESX host. POD is scheduled to restart on node2. Out of three disks attached to node1, two disk successfully got attached to node2 where the pod is scheduled, but 1 disk remained attached to node1.**


**Pod failed to start on another node. following error observed in the kubelet.service logs on the node1.**





```
W0508 00:36:34.250892     469 mount.go:131] could not determine device for path: "/var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume/pvc-f969cb9e-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12"
E0508 00:36:34.250925     469 reconciler.go:438] Could not construct volume information: directory /var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume/pvc-f969cb9e-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12 is not mounted
W0508 00:36:34.252084     469 mount.go:131] could not determine device for path: "/var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume/pvc-f94ac56f-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12"
E0508 00:36:34.252113     469 reconciler.go:438] Could not construct volume information: directory /var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume/pvc-f94ac56f-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12 is not mounted
E0508 00:36:34.697341     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "0ea83064-3383-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
E0508 00:36:34.697561     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
E0508 00:36:36.698103     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "0ea83064-3383-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
E0508 00:36:36.698194     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
E0508 00:36:38.695510     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "0ea83064-3383-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
E0508 00:36:38.695593     469 kubelet_volumes.go:114] Orphaned pod "f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" found, but volume paths are still present on disk.
```


30 GB Volume is getting listed on node1, but there is no mount point available. 
```
root@node1 [ ~ ]# lsblk
NAME   MAJ:MIN RM  SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
sdc      8:32   0   30G  0 disk 
sdd      8:48   0 15.6G  0 disk 
|-sdd1   8:49   0    2M  0 part 
`-sdd2   8:50   0    8G  0 part /
sr0     11:0    1 1024M  0 rom  
```


```
kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume ]# pwd
/var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume
root@node1 [ /var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/
kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume ]# ls -la
total 20
drwxr-x--- 5 root root 4096 May  7 23:43 .
drwxr-x--- 4 root root 4096 May  7 23:43 ..
drwxr-x--- 2 root root 4096 May  7 23:43 pvc-f94ac56f-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12
drwxr-x--- 2 root root 4096 May  7 23:43 pvc-f95ae165-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12
drwxr-x--- 2 root root 4096 May  7 23:43 pvc-f969cb9e-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12
root@node1 [ /var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/
kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume ]#
```

```
root@node1 [ /var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/
kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume/pvc-f94ac56f-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12 ]# ls
root@node1 [ /var/lib/kubelet/pods/f97942cf-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12/volumes/
kubernetes.io~vsphere-volume/pvc-f94ac56f-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12 ]#
```


```
$ kubectl get pod
NAME                              READY     STATUS              RESTARTS   AGE
wordpress-mysql-380239133-3nm5j   0/1       ContainerCreating   0          36m

$ kubectl describe pod
Name:		wordpress-mysql-380239133-3nm5j
Namespace:	default
Node:		node2/fe80::250:56ff:feb7:ccdc
Start Time:	Sun, 07 May 2017 17:30:24 -0700
Labels:		app=wordpress
		pod-template-hash=380239133
		tier=mysql
Annotations:	kubernetes.io/created-by={"kind":"SerializedReference","apiVersion":"v1","reference":{"kind":"ReplicaSet","namespace":"default","name":"wordpress-mysql-380239133","uid":"f977aec2-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056...
Status:		Pending
IP:		
Controllers:	ReplicaSet/wordpress-mysql-380239133
Containers:
  mysql:
    Container ID:	
    Image:		mysql:5.6
    Image ID:		
    Port:		3306/TCP
    State:		Waiting
      Reason:		ContainerCreating
    Ready:		False
    Restart Count:	0
    Environment:
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD:	mysqlpassword
    Mounts:
      /var/lib/mysql from mysql-persistent-storage1 (rw)
      /var/lib/mysql2 from mysql-persistent-storage2 (rw)
      /var/lib/mysql3 from mysql-persistent-storage3 (rw)
      /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from default-token-m6tlc (ro)
Conditions:
  Type		Status
  Initialized 	True 
  Ready 	False 
  PodScheduled 	True 
Volumes:
  mysql-persistent-storage1:
    Type:	PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:	mysql-pv-claim1
    ReadOnly:	false
  mysql-persistent-storage2:
    Type:	PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:	mysql-pv-claim2
    ReadOnly:	false
  mysql-persistent-storage3:
    Type:	PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:	mysql-pv-claim3
    ReadOnly:	false
  default-token-m6tlc:
    Type:	Secret (a volume populated by a Secret)
    SecretName:	default-token-m6tlc
    Optional:	false
QoS Class:	BestEffort
Node-Selectors:	<none>
Tolerations:	<none>
Events:
  FirstSeen	LastSeen	Count	From			SubObjectPath	Type		Reason		Message
  ---------	--------	-----	----			-------------	--------	------		-------
  36m		36m		1	default-scheduler			Normal		Scheduled	Successfully assigned wordpress-mysql-380239133-3nm5j to node2
  36m		36m		1	attachdetach				Warning		FailedMount	Failed to attach volume "pvc-f969cb9e-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" on node "node2" with: Failed to add disk 'scsi1:0'.
  35m		35m		1	attachdetach				Warning		FailedMount	Failed to attach volume "pvc-f95ae165-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" on node "node2" with: Failed to add disk 'scsi1:0'.
  35m		1m		20	attachdetach				Warning		FailedMount	Failed to attach volume "pvc-f95ae165-337e-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12" on node "node2" with: Failed to add disk 'scsi1:2'.
  34m		1m		15	kubelet, node2				Warning		FailedMount	Unable to mount volumes for pod "wordpress-mysql-380239133-3nm5j_default(869de145-3385-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12)": timeout expired waiting for volumes to attach/mount for pod "default"/"wordpress-mysql-380239133-3nm5j". list of unattached/unmounted volumes=[mysql-persistent-storage2]
  34m		1m		15	kubelet, node2				Warning		FailedSync	Error syncing pod, skipping: timeout expired waiting for volumes to attach/mount for pod "default"/"wordpress-mysql-380239133-3nm5j". list of unattached/unmounted volumes=[mysql-persistent-storage2]
$
```

**What you expected to happen**:
All volumes should be detached and unmounted from the node, when pod is scheduled on another node.

How to completely clean up this Orphaned pod "0ea83064-3383-11e7-b2b1-005056b7dc12"?



**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
power off the host containing node where pod is present. 

**Anything else we need to know**:

Need help to know about what's wrong here. why volume directory remains present on the node even after all volumes are unmounted.

This looks like a timing issue (some race condition), as issue is not always reproducible.

**kubelet Log file from node1.**
[kubelet.service.log.node1.txt](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/files/982132/kubelet.service.log.node1.txt)
title: Orphaned pod found - but volume paths are still present on disk
